item.title: Version 3
item.description: Rebuilt from the ground up, the new site is refined from the presentation to the source. The theme has been modernized to load faster and I created more ways to navigate the site so more data is easily accessible while keeping the idea of simplicity in mind.

item.title: jQuery CORS fix for IE8 and IE9
item.description: Who can blame jQuery for not wanting to support Internet Explorer? Despite whatever the reason, it doesn’t always make business sense and we must support it. I found this piece of code that patches the issue with jQuery.

item.title: Working with JavaScript templates using jQuery
item.description: I picked up this nifty way of templating HTML code for JavaScript while working at Monkey Quest and haven’t looked back. The idea here is to separate your design from your code. This is particularly useful when you are adding content to your site after the initial rendering. Data can be fed in from a number of sources and added to a page using a template.
